verses.verse: <WG1161> After <WG3326> these things <WG5023> SHa'ul <WG3972> departed <WG5563> <WG5685> from <WG1537> Athens <WG116>, and came <WG2064> <WG5627> to <WG1519> Corinth <WG2882>;

And <WG2532> found <WG2147> <WG5631> a certain <WG5100> Jew <WG2453> named <WG3686> Aquila <WG207>, born <WG1085> in Pontus <WG4193>, lately <WG4373> come <WG2064> <WG5756> from <WG575> Italy <WG2482>, with <WG2532> his <WG846> wife <WG1135> Priscilla <WG4252>; (because that <WG1223> Claudius <WG2804> had commanded <WG1299> <WG5760> all <WG3956> Jews <WG2453> to depart <WG5563> <WG5745> from <WG1537> Rome <WG4516>:) and came <WG4334> <WG5627> unto them <WG846>.

And <WG2532> because <WG1223> he was <WG1511> <WG5750> of the same craft <WG3673>, he abode <WG3306> <WG5707> with <WG3844> them <WG846>, and <WG2532> wrought <WG2038> <WG5711>: for <WG1063> by their occupation <WG5078> they were <WG2258> <WG5713> tentmakers <WG4635>.

And <WG1161> he reasoned <WG1256> <WG5711> in <WG1722> the synagogue <WG4864> <WG2596> every <WG3956> sabbath <WG4521>, and <WG5037> persuaded <WG3982> <WG5707> the Jews <WG2453> and <WG2532> the Greeks <WG1672>.

And <WG1161> when <WG5613> <WG5037> Sila <WG4609> and <WG2532> Timotheus <WG5095> were come <WG2718> <WG5627> from <WG575> Macedonia <WG3109>, SHa'ul <WG3972> was pressed <WG4912> <WG5712> in the spirit <WG4151>, and testified <WG1263> <WG5740> to the Jews <WG2453> that Yeshuw`a <WG2424> was Moshiach <WG5547>.

And <WG1161> when they opposed <WG498> <WG5734> themselves <WG846>, and <WG2532> blasphemed <WG987> <WG5723>, he shook <WG1621> <WG5671> his raiment <WG2440>, and said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto <WG4314> them <WG846>, Your <WG5216> blood <WG129> be upon <WG1909> your <WG5216> own heads <WG2776>; I <WG1473> am clean <WG2513>: from <WG575> henceforth <WG3568> I will go <WG4198> <WG5695> unto <WG1519> the goyim <WG1484>.

And <WG2532> he departed <WG3327> <WG5631> thence <WG1564>, and entered <WG2064> <WG5627> into <WG1519> a certain <WG5100> man's house <WG3614>, named <WG3686> Justus <WG2459>, one that worshipped <WG4576> <WG5740> 'Elohim <WG2316>, whose <WG3739> house <WG3614> joined hard <WG4927> <WG5723> <WG2258> <WG5713> to the synagogue <WG4864>.

And <WG1161> Crispus <WG2921>, the chief ruler of the synagogue <WG752>, believed <WG4100> <WG5656> on the YY <WG2962> with <WG4862> all <WG3650> his <WG846> house <WG3624>; and <WG2532> many <WG4183> of the Corinthians <WG2881> hearing <WG191> <WG5723> believed <WG4100> <WG5707>, and <WG2532> were immersed <WG907> <WG5712>.

Then <WG1161> spake <WG2036> <WG5627> the YY <WG2962> to SHa'ul <WG3972> in <WG1223> the night <WG3571> by <WG1722> a vision <WG3705>, Be <WG5399> not <WG3361> afraid <WG5399> <WG5737>, but <WG235> speak <WG2980> <WG5720>, and <WG2532> hold <WG4623> not <WG3361> thy peace <WG4623> <WG5661>:

For <WG1360> I <WG1473> am <WG1510> <WG5748> with <WG3326> thee <WG4675>, and <WG2532> no man <WG3762> shall set on <WG2007> <WG5698> thee <WG4671> to hurt <WG2559> <WG5658> thee <WG4571>: for <WG1360> I <WG3427> have <WG2076> <WG5748> much <WG4183> people <WG2992> in <WG1722> this <WG5026> city <WG4172>.

And <WG5037> he continued <WG2523> <WG5656> there a year <WG1763> and <WG2532> six <WG1803> months <WG3376>, teaching <WG1321> <WG5723> the word <WG3056> of 'Elohim <WG2316> among <WG1722> them <WG846>.

And <WG1161> when Gallio <WG1058> was the deputy <WG445> <WG5723> of Achaia <WG882>, the Jews <WG2453> made insurrection <WG2721> <WG5627> with one accord against <WG3661> SHa'ul <WG3972>, and <WG2532> brought <WG71> <WG5627> him <WG846> to <WG1909> the judgment seat <WG968>,
Saying <WG3004> <WG5723>, <WG3754> This <WG3778> fellow persuadeth <WG374> <WG5719> men <WG444> to worship <WG4576> <WG5738> 'Elohim <WG2316> contrary <WG3844> to the Torah <WG3551>.

And <WG1161> when SHa'ul <WG3972> was now about <WG3195> <WG5723> to open <WG455> <WG5721> his mouth <WG4750>, Gallio <WG1058> said <WG2036> <WG5627> unto <WG4314> the Jews <WG2453>, If <WG1487> <WG3303> <WG3767> it were <WG2258> <WG5713> a <WG5100> matter of wrong <WG92> or <WG2228> wicked <WG4190> lewdness <WG4467>, O <WG5599> ye Jews <WG2453>, reason <WG2596> <WG3056> would <WG302> that I should bear <WG430> <WG5633> with you <WG5216>:

But <WG1161> if <WG1487> it be <WG2076> <WG5748> a question <WG2213> of <WG4012> words <WG3056> and <WG2532> names <WG3686>, and <WG2532> of <WG2596> your <WG5209> Torah <WG3551>, look ye <WG3700> <WG5695> <WG846> to it; for <WG1063> I <WG1473> will be <WG1014> <WG5736> <WG1511> <WG5750> no <WG3756> judge <WG2923> of such <WG5130> matters.
And <WG2532> he drave <WG556> <WG5656> them <WG846> from <WG575> the judgment seat <WG968>.

Then <WG1161> all <WG3956> the Greeks <WG1672> took <WG1949> <WG5637> Sosthenes <WG4988>, the chief ruler of the synagogue <WG752>, and beat <WG5180> <WG5707> him before <WG1715> the judgment seat <WG968>. And <WG2532> Gallio <WG1058> cared <WG3199> <WG5707> for none <WG3762> of those things <WG5130>.

And <WG1161> SHa'ul <WG3972> after this tarried <WG4357> <WG5660> there yet <WG2089> a good <WG2425> while <WG2250>, and then took his leave <WG657> <WG5671> of the brethren <WG80>, and sailed thence <WG1602> <WG5707> into <WG1519> Syria <WG4947>, and <WG2532> with <WG4862> him <WG846> Priscilla <WG4252> and <WG2532> Aquila <WG207>; having sshofar <WG2751> <WG5671> his head <WG2776> in <WG1722> Cenchrea <WG2747>: for <WG1063> he had <WG2192> <WG5707> a vow <WG2171>.

And <WG1161> he came <WG2658> <WG5656> to <WG1519> Ephesus <WG2181>, and <WG2548> left <WG2641> <WG5627> them there <WG847>: but <WG1161> he himself <WG846> entered <WG1525> <WG5631> into <WG1519> the synagogue <WG4864>, and reasoned with <WG1256> <WG5675> the Jews <WG2453>.
When <WG1161> they <WG846> desired <WG2065> <WG5723> him to tarry <WG3306> <WG5658> longer <WG1909> <WG4119> time <WG5550> with <WG3844> them <WG846>, he consented <WG1962> <WG5656> not <WG3756>;

But <WG235> bade <WG657> them <WG846> farewell <WG657> <WG5662>, saying <WG2036> <WG5631>, I <WG3165> must <WG1163> <WG5748> by all means <WG3843> keep <WG4160> <WG5658> this feast <WG1859> that cometh <WG2064> <WG5740> in <WG1519> Yerushalayim <WG2414>: but <WG1161> I will return <WG344> <WG5692> again <WG3825> unto <WG4314> you <WG5209>, if 'Elohim <WG2316> will <WG2309> <WG5723>. And <WG2532> he sailed <WG321> <WG5681> from <WG575> Ephesus <WG2181>.

And <WG2532> when he had landed <WG2718> <WG5631> at <WG1519> Caesarea <WG2542>, and gone up <WG305> <WG5631>, and <WG2532> saluted <WG782> <WG5666> the Congregation <WG1577>, he went down <WG2597> <WG5627> to <WG1519> Antioch <WG490>.

And <WG2532> after he had spent <WG4160> <WG5660> some <WG5100> time <WG5550> there, he departed <WG1831> <WG5627>, and went over <WG1330> <WG5740> all the country <WG5561> of Galatia <WG1054> and <WG2532> Phrygia <WG5435> in order <WG2517>, strengthening <WG1991> <WG5723> all <WG3956> the Talmidim <WG3101>.

And <WG1161> a certain <WG5100> Jew <WG2453> named <WG3686> Apollos <WG625>, born <WG1085> at Alexandria <WG221>, an eloquent <WG3052> man <WG435>, and mighty <WG5607> <WG5752> <WG1415> in <WG1722> the scriptures <WG1124>, came <WG2658> <WG5656> to <WG1519> Ephesus <WG2181>.

This man <WG3778> was <WG2258> <WG5713> instructed in <WG2727> <WG5772> the way <WG3598> of the YY <WG2962>; and <WG2532> being fervent <WG2204> <WG5723> in the spirit <WG4151>, he spake <WG2980> <WG5707> and <WG2532> taught <WG1321> <WG5707> diligently <WG199> the things of <WG4012> the YY <WG2962>, knowing <WG1987> <WG5740> only <WG3440> the immersion <WG908> of Yochanan <WG2491>.

And <WG5037> he <WG3778> began <WG756> <WG5662> to speak boldly <WG3955> <WG5738> in <WG1722> the synagogue <WG4864>: whom <WG846> when <WG1161> Aquila <WG207> and <WG2532> Priscilla <WG4252> had heard <WG191> <WG5660>, they took <WG4355> <WG5639> him <WG846> unto them, and <WG2532> expounded <WG1620> <WG5639> unto him <WG846> the way <WG3598> of 'Elohim <WG2316> more perfectly <WG197>.

And <WG1161> when he <WG846> was disposed <WG1014> <WG5740> to pass <WG1330> <WG5629> into <WG1519> Achaia <WG882>, the brethren <WG80> wrote <WG1125> <WG5656>, exhorting <WG4389> <WG5671> the Talmidim <WG3101> to receive <WG588> <WG5664> him <WG846>: who <WG3739>, when he was come <WG3854> <WG5637>, helped them <WG4820> <WG5639> much <WG4183> which had believed <WG4100> <WG5761> through <WG1223> grace <WG5485>:

For <WG1063> he mightily <WG2159> convinced <WG1246> <WG5711> the Jews <WG2453>, and that publickly <WG1219>, shewing <WG1925> <WG5723> by <WG1223> the scriptures <WG1124> that Yeshuw`a <WG2424> was <WG1511> <WG5750> Moshiach <WG5547>.
